Class Round

  • java.lang.Object
    • Round

  • public class Round
extends java.lang.Object
    The Class Round plays a round of the card game Hearts. A round consists of 13 tricks. Scores are added up at the end of the round.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Round(Player[] players)
      Instantiates a new round with a list of players.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void calculateScores()
      Calculates the total scores of each player for the round.
      int[] getScores()
      Gets the round scores of the players.
      void playRound()
      Play round of Hearts.
      boolean shotTheMoon()
      Determines whether a player 'shot the moon' (took all 13 points cards).
      int twoOfClubsPosition()
      Find the index position of the player holding the Two of Clubs.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Round

        public Round(Player[] players)
        Instantiates a new round with a list of players. Round scores are initialized to zero, there are currently thirteen tricks remaining, hearts are not broken and points cards are not allowed to be played.
        Parameters:
        players - the players to play the round

    • Method Detail

      • twoOfClubsPosition

        public int twoOfClubsPosition()
        Find the index position of the player holding the Two of Clubs.
        Returns:
        the int position of the player with the Two of Clubs

      • playRound

        public void playRound()
        Play round of Hearts. Goes through the thirteen tricks, The first trick is led with the player who holds the Two of Clubs. Subsequent tricks are led by the winner of the previous trick. The points for each player are maintained. In the roundScores array.

      • shotTheMoon

        public boolean shotTheMoon()
        Determines whether a player 'shot the moon' (took all 13 points cards). A player who manages to shoot the moon receives a round score of zero, while all other players receive 26.
        Returns:
        true, if a player 'shot the moon'

      • getScores

        public int[] getScores()
        Gets the round scores of the players.
        Returns:
        the round scores of the players

      • calculateScores

        public void calculateScores()
        Calculates the total scores of each player for the round.
